metadata.title: Public Companies Targeted by Greenpeace for Toxic Waste
metadata.description: A comprehensive list of public companies targeted by Greenpeace campaigns specifically for toxic waste pollution including air, land, water, and nuclear waste

fashion_and_textiles.description: Companies targeted by Greenpeace's Detox Campaign launched in 2011 to eliminate hazardous chemicals from textile production that pollute waterways

companies.name: H&M
companies.issues: Textile production releasing toxic chemicals into Chinese rivers

companies.name: Zara (Inditex)
companies.issues: Textile production releasing toxic chemicals into waterways

companies.name: Nike
companies.issues: Hazardous chemicals in sportswear manufacturing, water pollution in supplier factories

companies.name: Adidas
companies.issues: Hazardous chemicals in sportswear manufacturing, PFCs in products

companies.name: Puma
companies.issues: Toxic chemicals in sportswear production

companies.name: Primark (Associated British Foods)
companies.issues: Toxic chemicals in fast fashion production

companies.name: Tchibo (Maxingvest AG)
companies.issues: Toxic chemicals in clothing production

companies.name: Aldi (Aldi Süd)
companies.issues: Toxic chemicals in retail clothing products

companies.name: Lidl (Schwarz Gruppe)
companies.issues: Toxic chemicals in retail clothing products

oil_and_gas.description: Oil and gas companies targeted for toxic waste dumping, fracking pollution, and plastic production

companies.name: Shell (Royal Dutch Shell)
companies.issues: Illegal toxic waste dumps from fracking in Patagonia, North Sea oil waste dumping, plastic production, microplastic chemical lobbying
companies.campaign: Patagonia fracking investigation, North Sea oil platform decommissioning

companies.name: TotalEnergies (formerly Total)
companies.issues: Illegal toxic waste dumps from fracking in Patagonia

companies.name: ExxonMobil
companies.issues: Toxic waste from fracking in Patagonia, plastic production expansion, microplastic chemical lobbying
companies.campaign: Patagonia fracking investigation, plastics treaty lobbying

companies.name: BP
companies.issues: Pan American Energy (BP subsidiary) dumping toxic fracking waste in Patagonia, microplastic chemical lobbying

chemicals.description: Chemical companies targeted for PFAS 'forever chemicals' and toxic chemical production

companies.name: 3M
companies.issues: PFAS 'forever chemicals' production and contamination, concealed health hazards since 1960s, exploiting regulatory loopholes

companies.name: DuPont (now DuPont de Nemours)
companies.issues: PFAS production and water contamination, concealed health risks since 1970s, C-8 contamination in North Carolina

companies.name: Chemours (spun off from DuPont)
companies.issues: Continued discharge of PFAS into Cape Fear River, North Carolina despite known health risks

companies.name: Dow Chemical (now Dow Inc.)
companies.issues: PFAS releases exploiting regulatory loopholes, microplastic chemical lobbying

companies.name: BASF
companies.issues: Lobbying against regulation of UV-328 plastic additive chemical

companies.name: INEOS
companies.issues: Plastic production expansion, lobbying against plastics treaty

coal_and_energy.description: Coal power companies targeted for air pollution, particulate matter, and toxic emissions

companies.name: RWE
companies.issues: Largest lignite coal burner in Europe, responsible for thousands of premature deaths, health costs of €48 per MWh

companies.name: EPH (Energetický a průmyslový holding)
companies.issues: Second worst coal company in Europe, burning highly polluting lignite coal

nuclear.description: Nuclear companies targeted for radioactive waste dumping and unsafe storage

companies.name: Orano (formerly Areva)
companies.issues: Dumping radioactive waste at unsafe site in Seversk, Siberia, restarted exports after 11-year hiatus

companies.name: EDF (Électricité de France)
companies.issues: Nuclear waste shipments to Russia (Rosatom deal 2018)

companies.name: UKAEA (UK Atomic Energy Authority)
companies.issues: Nuclear waste disposal at sea in 1970s-80s
